intro: Neoachmandra macrantha, commonly known as the large-flowered neoachmandra, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. The plant has compound leaves with multiple leaflets and produces small, berry-like fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
